definition: to travel extensively
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
south
surname Nan
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
north/(classical) to be defeated

sentences.english: Outside the fixed asset brings, to be widely traveled along with makes the block.
sentences.chinese: 牢固资产随身带，走南闯北挣外块。

sentences.english: Obviously, it is teamwork that makes it possible for them to go anywhere they want to.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，正是合作才使得他们走南闯北成为可能。

sentences.english: Magda tramped about with a magician .
sentences.chinese: 玛格达跟着一个魔术师走南闯北。

sentences.english: Photographers travel around just for input, to draw a circle in their souls.
sentences.chinese: 摄影家走南闯北是为了输入，在自己的心灵画个圆。

definition: to travel around the country
to travel around the country (as itinerant peddler or entertainer)
the wider world/diverse aspects of society
to make a living as a traveling performer etc
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
experienced and knowledgeable (idiom)
traveling salesman/itinerant trader/hawker/peddler
to tour/to travel
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
half of a lifetime
to roam about/to wander without a home
